title: Attacks in Gaza and Israel kill more than 40, many of them children
content: An Israeli strike in Gaza killed at least 30 people. In northern Israel, a rocket attack the military blamed on Hezbollah left 11 people dead.
summary: An Israeli strike in Gaza killed at least 30 people. In northern Israel, a rocket attack the military blamed on Hezbollah left 11 people dead.

title: After ‘big show’ in U.S., Netanyahu faces political battles at home
content: The prime minster’s inner circle was largely satisfied with the trip — but it might not solve Netanyahu’s cratering popularity among the Israeli electorate.
summary: The prime minster’s inner circle was largely satisfied with the trip — but it might not solve Netanyahu’s cratering popularity among the Israeli electorate.

title: How many athletes are in the Paris Olympics, and other key numbers
content: The Paris Olympic Games will see about 11,040 athletes take part in 32 sports including athletics, basketball and rowing. Here are the numbers you need to know.
summary: The Paris Olympic Games will see about 11,040 athletes take part in 32 sports including athletics, basketball and rowing. Here are the numbers you need to know.

title: In Miami, Venezuelan diaspora anxiously watches a vote it can’t participate in
content: Many Venezuelans in the United States would like to cast ballots against Nicolás Maduro. But the vast majority won’t be able to vote in what could be a consequential election.
summary: Many Venezuelans in the United States would like to cast ballots against Nicolás Maduro. But the vast majority won’t be able to vote in what could be a consequential election.

title: Netanyahu’s U.S. visit revealed ‘no workable plan’ for peace, critics say
content: A “day after” plan in Gaza is a critical component of President Biden’s vision for peace. Lawmakers say that, for all the effort, it remains a pipe dream.
summary: A “day after” plan in Gaza is a critical component of President Biden’s vision for peace. Lawmakers say that, for all the effort, it remains a pipe dream.

title: U.S., Japan to unveil first steps towards enhanced military alliance
content: Biden administration looks to strengthen deterrence against China with a new joint operational command in Japan.
summary: Biden administration looks to strengthen deterrence against China with a new joint operational command in Japan.

title: If Maduro loses, will he cede power? Venezuela’s election, explained.
content: The opposition is hoping for a victory so overwhelming that the authoritarian socialist will be compelled to negotiate a transition.
summary: The opposition is hoping for a victory so overwhelming that the authoritarian socialist will be compelled to negotiate a transition.

title: Russia, adapting tactics, advances in Donetsk and takes more Ukrainian land
content: The new offensive focus comes as Ukraine faces depleted forces, sweltering heat and turmoil in a potentially consequential U.S. election.
summary: The new offensive focus comes as Ukraine faces depleted forces, sweltering heat and turmoil in a potentially consequential U.S. election.

title: The Paris Olympics, in comics
content: We asked our favorite cartoonists to watch and live illustrate the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics.
summary: We asked our favorite cartoonists to watch and live illustrate the 2024 Paris Summer Olympics.

title: Olympic Ceremonies on the Seine were a daring feat. Paris stuck the landing.
content: Paris transformed into a spectacular stage — and demonstrated that bold thinking could bring a shine back to a global event that has seen its popularity slump.
summary: Paris transformed into a spectacular stage — and demonstrated that bold thinking could bring a shine back to a global event that has seen its popularity slump.

title: Mexico wasn’t told of cartel arrests until kingpins were in U.S. custody
content: The capture of Sinaloa cartel leaders Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada and Joaquín Guzmán López was a historic coup against a syndicate that’s flooded the United States with fentanyl.
summary: The capture of Sinaloa cartel leaders Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada and Joaquín Guzmán López was a historic coup against a syndicate that’s flooded the United States with fentanyl.

title: Arson attacks target France’s high speed trains hours before Olympics
content: France condemned coordinated “acts of sabotage” on high-speed rail lines, which caused mass disruptions before the Opening Ceremonies of the Paris Olympic Games.
summary: France condemned coordinated “acts of sabotage” on high-speed rail lines, which caused mass disruptions before the Opening Ceremonies of the Paris Olympic Games.

title: U.K. ending challenge to ICC arrest warrants for Israeli leaders
content: The withdrawal of its opposition to the arrest warrants puts the new British government at odds with the Biden administration.
summary: The withdrawal of its opposition to the arrest warrants puts the new British government at odds with the Biden administration.

title: What to know about the Sinaloa cartel after the arrest of ‘El Mayo’
content: Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada was a kingpin in Mexico’s Sinaloa cartel, the world’s top producer of fentanyl. He was arrested alongside the son of “El Chapo.”
summary: Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada was a kingpin in Mexico’s Sinaloa cartel, the world’s top producer of fentanyl. He was arrested alongside the son of “El Chapo.”

title: From ‘sunny ways’ to cloudy days: Canadians have tired of Justin Trudeau
content: The charismatic son of former Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau has won three elections and rescued the Liberal Party from irrelevance. Now voters want change.
summary: The charismatic son of former Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau has won three elections and rescued the Liberal Party from irrelevance. Now voters want change.

title: Video of police kicking man on ground at U.K. airport sparks protests
content: Video of the incident at Manchester Airport showed an officer kicking a man in the head, leading to accusations of police brutality. The officer has been suspended.
summary: Video of the incident at Manchester Airport showed an officer kicking a man in the head, leading to accusations of police brutality. The officer has been suspended.

title: Russia wary of U.S. and France election surprises, especially Kamala Harris
content: Harris, largely unknown to the Russians, is viewed with alarm.
summary: Harris, largely unknown to the Russians, is viewed with alarm.

title: Olympics quiz: Pick the right anthems, flags and avoid a diplomatic incident
content: Previous Olympics have played the wrong national anthems, or displayed the wrong flags - angering players and supporters. Can you do any better?
summary: Previous Olympics have played the wrong national anthems, or displayed the wrong flags - angering players and supporters. Can you do any better?

title: How one Chinese machine tool maker is helping Russia’s war against Ukraine
content: NATO has accused Beijing of being a “decisive enabler” of Moscow’s ongoing war. The case of Oree Laser, now sanctioned by the U.S., shows how China is helping Russia.
summary: NATO has accused Beijing of being a “decisive enabler” of Moscow’s ongoing war. The case of Oree Laser, now sanctioned by the U.S., shows how China is helping Russia.

title: Top Sinaloa cartel leader taken into U.S. custody alongside son of  ‘El Chapo’
content: Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada was fooled into boarding a U.S.-bound private plane with Joaquin Guzmán, El Chapo’s son, who was also detained, a DHS official said.
summary: Ismael “El Mayo” Zambada was fooled into boarding a U.S.-bound private plane with Joaquin Guzmán, El Chapo’s son, who was also detained, a DHS official said.

title: Is this the beginning of the end for the Maduro regime in Venezuela?
content: After a decade of economic calamity and political repression, Venezuela stands on the brink of once-unfathomable change: Maduro may lose the presidency by a landslide.
summary: After a decade of economic calamity and political repression, Venezuela stands on the brink of once-unfathomable change: Maduro may lose the presidency by a landslide.

title: Harris calls for cease-fire and hostage release after Netanyahu meeting
content: The White House is trying to pressure the Israeli prime minister to accept terms of a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.
summary: The White House is trying to pressure the Israeli prime minister to accept terms of a cease-fire and hostage-release deal.

title: How Paris made the city the stage for the 2024 Olympics
content: Instead of building new stadiums, Paris is embedding Olympic events in the French capital and hoping to highlight its history and green transformation.
summary: Instead of building new stadiums, Paris is embedding Olympic events in the French capital and hoping to highlight its history and green transformation.

title: New U.K. state company to develop offshore wind on seabed owned by Charles III
content: The Crown Estate, the monarchy’s real estate firm, owns much of the seabed surrounding Britain.
summary: The Crown Estate, the monarchy’s real estate firm, owns much of the seabed surrounding Britain.
